intro: Caralluma keithii, commonly known as the Natal carpetweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers during the warmer months. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Caralluma keithii is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
